attributes.text:
Form Controller

General idea

The form controller is responsible for connecting a from with a model. If no model is given, a model can be created. This created form will fit exactly to the given form and can be used for serialization. All the connections between the form items and the model are handled by an internal {@link qx.data.controller.Object}.

Features

  • Connect a form to a model (bidirectional)
  • Create a model for a given form

Usage

The controller only work if both, a controller and a model are set. Creating a model will automatically set the created model.

Cross reference

  • If you want to bind single values, use {@link qx.data.controller.Object}
  • If you want to bind a list like widget, use {@link qx.data.controller.List}
  • If you want to bind a tree widget, use {@link qx.data.controller.Tree}
The model to bind the target to. The given object will be set as {@link #model} property.
The form which contains the form items. The given form will be set as {@link #target} property.
Fired on change of the property {@link #model}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #target}.
The form item to check.
Returns whether the given item implements {@link qx.ui.core.ISingleSelection} and {@link qx.ui.form.IModelSelection}.
true, if given item fits.
Internal helper for setting up the bindings using {@link qx.data.controller.Object#addTarget}. All bindings are set up bidirectional.
The form which has been removed.
Internal helper for removing all set up bindings using {@link qx.data.controller.Object#removeTarget}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property target.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.
The name of the form item for which the options should be used.
Options map used for the binding from model to target. The possible options can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} class.
Options map used for the binding from target to model. The possible options can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} class.

The form controller uses for setting up the bindings the fundamental binding layer, the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding}. To achieve a binding in both directions, two bindings are neede. With this method, you have the opportunity to set the options used for the bindings.
Whether the model should support the bubbling of change events or not.

Creates and sets a model using the {@link qx.data.marshal.Json} object. Remember that this method can only work if the form is set. The created model will fit exactly that form. Changing the form or adding an item to the form will need a new model creation.
The created model.

Returns the (computed) value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
(Computed) value of model.

Returns the (computed) value of the property target.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.
(Computed) value of target.
Initial value for property model.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property model with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
the default value
Initial value for property target.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property target with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.
the default value

Resets the user value of the property model.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.

Resets the user value of the property target.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.
New value for property model.

Sets the user value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property target.

Sets the user value of the property target.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #target}.
The unmodified incoming value.
Data object containing the data which should be shown in the target.
The target widget which should show the data.
